revised_title: European Contributions to Bubble-Chamber Physics at C.E.R.N.
tldr: The article discusses the development of bubble-chamber techniques for research at high-energy proton synchrotrons, focusing on European contributions to the field at CERN. It describes the essential features of bubble-chambers, the production of homogeneous particle beams, and the analysis of the millions of stereo-pictures taken at CERN in the last two years. The article highlights the importance of international collaboration and the challenges faced in beam definition, data analysis, and automatic measurement of pictures.
